This is... the story... that you started, isn't it?

Un juego donde priman la lógica y el ensayo y error. A pesar de su corta duración, su valor de rejugabilidad radica en los logros que tengas pendientes tras pasártelo la primera vez. Que comparta universo con Half-Life y lo críptico de su lore con una antagonista tan inquietante como GLADOS, hacen de esta IP una obra muy interesante. 

Es el primer juego con mecánicas de FPS donde no te das de tiros con hordas de enemigos ni debes racionar munición. Una joya imperdible aunque por lo corto que es, mejor comprarlo de oferta.

Playing this back in 2007 was one of my all time best experiences in gaming. It was a combination of factors that made it an experience that forever altered how I looked at videogames.

Portal is a First Person Puzzle game. Back in the day, this was practically unheard of. And the main way to solve puzzles - through portals - was a very fresh and mindbending concept. Couple this with excellent level design, writing that made me laugh out loud on multiple occasions, a surprise (for me) song at the end, and a very reasonable 4h runtime and maybe you'll get a glimpse of what the experience was like.

I don't think anyone playing this game today will get their socks blown off in quite the same way, but they will still find a charming, funny and clever game rewards the player with feeling smart overcoming it's many puzzles. 

I couldn't recommend this game more.

I got this game when it was on sale for two dollars, and I would buy it for the normal price. It is a fun game and it really has your mind turning. The story of this game is amazing, and after asking the community and digging around in youtube videos I have found there is more lore to the game than it initially lets on. I really enjoyed playing and beating this game, the graphics aren't the best but they are still really enjoyable. I would by no means say this game is perfect, but it is worth buying and playing. That's my review of the game and I hope you found it helpful.
(P.S. Song at the end of the game is lit.)
